messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Metropolitan Museum of Art Japanese Arms and Armor Show
messages.msgSnippet: My thought exactly, Les.  Also, there will be a free (with museum admission) half day symposium on Sunday, November 8 with lectures by Morihiro Ogawa, curator
messages.messageBody:
My thought exactly, Les. Also, there will be a free (with museum admission) half day symposium on Sunday, November 8 with lectures by Morihiro Ogawa, curator of the exhibition; Victor Harris, British Museum and The Japan Society; Norio Suzuki, Director-General, National Research Institute for Cultural Properties, Tokyo; and sword polisher Okisato Fujishiro.

Details can be found at http://tinyurl.com/odofqn

A catalog of the exhibition will be published: 9x11 75 b/w and 300 color illustrations, $65. I don't know when that will be available.

Jim
www.jimgilbertphoto.com



----- Original Message -----
From: Les Dorfman MD
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, August 29, 2009 3:27 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Metropolitan Museum of Art Japanese Arms and Armor Show


Wow!

----- Original Message -----
From: "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, August 28, 2009 8:18:45 PM GMT -08:00 US/Canada Pacific
Subject: [nihontostudy] Metropolitan Museum of Art Japanese Arms and Armor Show



For those interested in the big show in NY this fall, here is the exclusive news on the full list of important items that will be on display...

Art of the Samurai: Japanese Arms and Armor, 1156-1868

The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 21, 2009 - January 10, 2010

1. Haniwa (terracotta sculpture) of a standing warrior

Kofun Period, 6th century

Earthenware

H. 124.8 cm (48⅛ in.)

Aikawa Archaeological Museum, Gunma Prefecture

Important Cultural Property

Kofun Period, 5th century

Iron

Shiga Prefecture Azuchi Castle Archaeological Museum

Important Cultural Property

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Metropolitan Museum of Art Japanese Arms and Armor Show
messages.msgSnippet: Wow! ... From: Jim Gilbert  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Friday, August 28, 2009 8:18:45 PM GMT -08:00 US/Canada Pacific
messages.messageBody:
Wow!


----- Original Message -----
From: "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, August 28, 2009 8:18:45 PM GMT -08:00 US/Canada Pacific
Subject: [nihontostudy] Metropolitan Museum of Art Japanese Arms and Armor Show

 




For those interested in the big show in NY this fall, here is the exclusive news on the full list of important items that will be on display...

messages.subject: Metropolitan Museum of Art Japanese Arms and Armor Show
messages.msgSnippet: For those interested in the big show in NY this fall, here is the exclusive news on the full list of important items that will be on display... Art of the
messages.messageBody:
For those interested in the big show in NY this fall, here is the exclusive news on the full list of important items that will be on display...



Art of the Samurai: Japanese Arms and Armor, 1156-1868



The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 21, 2009 - January 10, 2010





1. Haniwa (terracotta sculpture) of a standing warrior

Kofun Period, 6th century

Earthenware

H. 124.8 cm (48⅛ in.)

Aikawa Archaeological Museum, Gunma Prefecture

Important Cultural Property

Kofun Period, 5th century

Iron

H. of helmet bowl, 13.5 cm (5⅜ in.); H. of neck guard 15 cm (5⅞ in.); H. of cuirass 45 cm (17¾ in.)

Shiga Prefecture Azuchi Castle Archaeological Museum

Important Cultural Property

Iron, copper, gold, leather, and silk

Okayama Prefectural Museum

National Treasure
